description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

description:
In Kazakhstan, Working parents in Kazakhstan will be given the opportunity to send their children to kindergartens.     
As Deputy Prime Minister Eraly Tugzhanov explained, taking into account the current restrictions of the quarantine regime, the possibility is now considered that no more than 15 children come to kindergartens in each group.

description:
Kazakhstan, starting May 12, 2020: "Nur-Sultan city's kindergartens will admit only children with certificates from a pediatrician of that the child and everyone in the family are healthy. 
The opening is allowed for one age group on duty, based on the condition that the distance is not less than one meter in the sleeping areas, but not more than 15 children in the group. These are groups combining nursery and first junior, second junior and combined senior and preschool groups"

description:
In Kazakhstan, from 13 September 2020, for the first quarter of this academic year, most of the students will study remotely. 
There are a few schools that remain to open with sanitation requirements in place. The activities of the duty classes are carried out with a capacity of no more than 15 people in strict observance of sanitary and epidemiological requirements.

description: From October 21, 2020 the Ministry of Education and Science of Kazakhstan introduced optional on-site classes for primary schools, trying to balance the pandemic risks and educational needs of younger children. Over 2,800 rural schools in remote areas of Kazakhstan continue to operate in strict compliance with the new sanitary and hygiene norms. They provide multi-shift schooling for pupils, whose parents opted in for offline studies.

description: The city of Taldykorgan extends distance learning in schools and gymnasiums until January 21, 2021 due to the epidemiological situation. From January 8, 2021, distance learning in schools and gymnasiums in the city of Taldykorgan has been extended for an additional 10 days due to the current epidemiological situation. Full-time offline education for grades 9, 11, 12 and grades 1-5 with the number of students in classes no more than 15 will begin on January 21, 2021.

description:
In Kazakhstan, new amendments allow for university students to get back to traditional classrooms for applied classes in laboratories and seminars. Universities will be equipped with non-contact thermometers, sanitizers, and disinfectant tunnels.
The school children of the graduating class will have 70 percent of their classes in classrooms with no more than 15 people. 
The schoolchildren can also study and live in boarding schools, attend individual classes of no more than five people. In addition to that, schools with up to 300 students in total can invite children to classrooms of up to 15 people.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Number of people on the school premises are limited (e.g. only 50 people allowed on school premises),Partial remote/distance learning  (e.g. Teachers with certain health conditions can tele-teach)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In Kazakhstan, from March 1, 2021, a study in a combined format is allowed for students of preschool grades, from grades 1 to 5 inclusive, in international schools - from grades 1 to 7 inclusive, with the number of children in classes no more than 25 people. 
In addition, study in a combined format for 6 days of the week for graduation classes (grades 9, 11 (12)): 70% of subjects in the regular mode, 30% - in the distance (no more than 15 people in a class, training according to the principle "1 grade - 1 cabinet ", compliance with sanitary-disinfection and mask regimes);

In Kazakhstan, from 1 September, 2021 all schools and universities are allowed to open with strict sanitary measures. description:
In Kazakhstan, the vaccination campaign against the COVID-19 virus is to start on February 1, 2021, with Russia’s Gam-COVID-Vac kicking off the campaign.
The staged vaccination campaign primarily targets the vulnerable groups of people who are at high risk of being infected or spreading the virus. The rest of the population are next in line for immunization.

description:
In Kazakhstan, the authorities plan to vaccinate six million people (about one third of the population) free of charge by end-2021. 
In addition, a locally developed vaccine (QazCovid-in) and the vaccine developed by Pfizer/BioNTech are expected to be available later in the year. 
Mass vaccination is expected to start after priority groups complete vaccination, likely in May.

description:
Kazakhstan: "Kazakhstan eases quarantine measures for arrivals from abroad on Jun. 8, 2020:
- According to the decree, persons arriving in the Republic of Kazakhstan from overseas would have to be placed in a quarantine hospital for up to 2 days for conducting COVID-19 laboratory testing.
- Persons who have arrived to Kazakhstan from abroad by flights and who have submitted negative COVID-19 examination certificate (issued no later than 5 days before the date of crossing the state border of the Republic of Kazakhstan) are not subject to placing in a quarantine hospital for COVID-19 laboratory
- Persons arriving from the states of the EAEU and the Republic of Uzbekistan through checkpoints across the State border of the Republic of Kazakhstan by rail, sea, river and motor transport would have to undergo medical tests for COVID-19 at the points of crossing the State border of the Republic of Kazakhstan."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
The Main Sanitary Doctor of East Kazakhstan region, from from November 15, 2021, decrees to provide:
Laboratories conducting PCR studies, regardless of ownership:

1) those who carry out testing for epidemiological, preventive purposes and within the framework of epidemiological supervision are subject to mandatory external quality assessment (interlaboratory comparison tests (professional testing)) in the Branch of the NPCSEEM NCOZ;

2) to provide to the Department of Sanitary and Epidemiological Control of the East Kazakhstan Region, its territorial administrations in cities and districts of the region and the Center for Localization of Foci (CLO) namesake lists and reports on all primary cases of positive results of PCR research (regardless of the funding of these studies: within the framework of the GOBMP or paid services), as well as reporting on the number and categories of tested persons, in accordance with the established form and multiplicity
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

their workers undergo PCR testing with the following recommended frequency of its implementation:

unvaccinated workers, workers with temporary and permanent medical contraindications, shift workers who regularly travel outside the shift settlement - with a multiplicity of 1 every 7 days;

shift workers who do not leave the watch for the entire period - with a multiplicity of 1 time (no later than 72 hours) before arrival for the next watch and 5 days before departure from the watch starting from November 15, 2021.

description: Starting from March 27, 2021, everyone who enters or leaves the Uilsky district of Aktobe, Kazakhstan, will have their temperature measured and data recorded. Those who have symptoms of COVID-19 will be isolated for two days in a quarantine hospital for PCR testing.

description:
Due to deterioration of the epidemiological situation, the East Kazakhstan region has strengthen public health restrictions, including entry and exit restrictions out and into the region starting from April 02, 2021.   A number of road sanitary control posts have been deployed for vehicle and pedestrian crossings.     
Both entry and exit of people to and from the territory (s) of the region will be prohibited except for limited individuals upon prior presentation of supporting/approving documents from the local authorities.  Each authorized traveler must undergo a temperature check and fill out a questionnaire on prior travel, potential Covid-19 exposure, and contact information.   
Those who have symptoms of Covid-19 are isolated for up to 2 days in a local quarantine hospital for PCR testing. If the result is positive, they will be sent to the infectious diseases hospital.      
In addition, the authorized travelers coming from “red zones” of Kazakhstan (as of April 2 they are: Nur-Sultan city, Almaty city, Atyrau, Aktobe, Almaty, and West Kazakhstan regions) will be required to provide a negative result of PCR test for Covid-19 for a period of no more than 3 days (72 hours). If they are unable to provide negative PCR test results, they will be denied entry.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Kazakhstan, June 12, 2020:

By the order of the Chief Sanitary Doctor of the Jambyl Region (Kazakhstan) Gaziz Naduyev, in the Jambyl region, the quarantine and restrictive measures are to be intensified following the increase in the coronavirus infection cases to up to 13.6% in last seven days. Such measures include limited movement of the public and between districts from 10 pm to 6 am, banning public transport, and restricting working hours of all markets. The Public Service Centers are allowed to operate from 9 am to 4 pm. Parks and squares will cut down on working hours. Under-aged are not allowed to walk without adult supervision.

description:
By the order of the Chief Sanitary Doctor of the Nur-Sultan city (Kazakhstan) № 210 dated on 3rd July 2020, due to the continued surge in coronavirus cases in Nur-Sultan the city imposes strict
quarantine restriction starting from 00:00 July 5 until 00:00
July 19, 2020 (with possible prolongation).

People are urged to keep the following requirements: it is
forbidden to hold sports and mass, family events, forums,
conferences, seminars, meetings, etc., People aged above 65
are restricted to go outside. Wearing of face masks, social
distancing are obligatory. People are allowed to gather in
groups of more than 3, to go to work, visit parks, squares.
Public transport service is to be also suspended for two
weeks.
Update: the lockdown was extended until August 2, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

UPDATE: it was extended up to including August 17, 2021 according to chief sanitary doctor on 30/07/2021 UPDATE: The policy which was initially set to end on 07.19.2021 was extended to 08.17.2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: From 00:00 on July 24 to 00:00 on July 27 and from 00:00 on July 31 to 00:00 on August 3, movement will be restricted both in the region and within settlements in North Kazakhstan region. Citizens can only leave home to and from work, to the grocery store or pharmacy, to the hospital in an emergency. Citizens can also walk animals near the house. Visits of guests, family events are prohibited.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Starting from July 5, 2020, Kazakhstan implements a two-week lockdown until July 19, 2020. Authorities will close some non-essential businesses, limit travel between provinces, cut public transit services’ hours of operation, and ban public gatherings. The measures may be tightened or extended later. UPDATE: Lockdown has been further extended until August 2, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On May 11, 2020, Prime minister of Kazakhstan announced that the following documents remain valid past the expiration date if it is the date within the period of the state of emergency and 60 days after it:
- permits for entry and exit (visas), permits for temporary and permanent residence in the Republic of Kazakhstan, permits for a labour immigrant and employer to attract foreign labour, certificates of an asylum seeker. 
The policy is to be enforced retroactively, from March 16, 2020 and last until July 9, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_text: prolongation of the validity of expired document
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Migrant workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description:
On May 11, 2020, Prime minister of Kazakhstan announced that within the period of the state of emergency and 60 days after it:
for citizens of Kazakhstan who have reached the age of sixteen and have not received an identity document, the main document proving their identity for the specified period is a birth certificate or passport.
   The policy is to be enforced retroactively, from March 16, 2020 and last until July 9, 2020.

description:
Starting Feb. 20, 2020, by the decree of Kazakhstan's Chief State Sanitary inspector "On further tightening measures for coronavirus infection prevention in Kazakhstan", Kazakhstan will place people in home quarantine for 24 days for those who are traveling from countries with more than 10 cases. 
The first 14 days will include daily calls from nurses. Additionally, anyone traveling from outside of the country will be placed in home quarantine for 24 days and will receive phone calls during that time.

description: By the order of the Chief Sanitary Doctor of the Almaty Region № 10 dated on 11th May 2020, starting from 11th May 2020, persons arriving from the EAEU countries and the Republic of Uzbekistan through checkpoints across the State border of the Republic of Kazakhstan on railway transport and road crossings are subject to laboratory examination for COVID-19 and self-isolation at home (home quarantine) for 12 days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
By the order of the Chief Sanitary Doctor of the Almaty Region № 10 dated on 11th May 2020, persons arriving from the EAEU countries and the Republic of Uzbekistan through checkpoints across the State border of the Republic of Kazakhstan by rail and road crossings that have signs that do not exclude COVID-19, bypassing the quarantine hospital, are hospitalized in a provisional hospital.

After receiving the results of laboratory tests for COVID-19, persons with a positive result are transferred to an infectious diseases hospital for treatment, persons with a negative result for COVID-19 are isolated at home (home quarantine) for 12 days. In the absence of conditions for isolation at home, isolation in a quarantine hospital is recommended in accordance with Appendices 1 and 2 to this decree.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
On Mar 3, SUNY institutions announced that they will have students in study abroad programs in countries with high prevalence of coronavirus return home - will review all study abroad programs ahead of potential expanded travel restrictions by federal government. 

On Mar 4, Governor Cuomo Announced SUNY and CUNY Study Abroad Programs in China, Italy, Japan, Iran, South Korea Suspended Effective Immediately in Response to Novel Coronavirus Concerns
SUNY and CUNY Arranging Immediate Return Travel for Approximately 300 Students
Individuals Returning from Impacted Countries Will Fly into New York Stewart International Airport and Urge Quarantine at Designated Dormitories
Campus-Sponsored Travel Outside the U.S. for both SUNY and CUNY Canceled for Spring Semester to Impacted Countries UPDATE: On Mar 4, SUNY announced The Study Abroad Programs in China, Italy, Japan, Iran, South Korea Suspended

description: By the order of the Chief sanitary doctor of the East Kazakhstan Region, starting from Apr. 2, 2020, all non-essential businesses in Semey and Usk-Kamenogorsk cities are obliged to cease activities with the exception of food-based, pharmacies and banks. UPDATE: The original policy targeted Semey and Ust-Kamenogorsk cities. A new policy by the order of the Chief sanitary doctor of the East Kazakhstan Region, starting from 18 April 2020, states that all regional non-essential businesses are to stop working, with the exceptions of notarial services, hotels, hostels, hotel complexes, pharmacies, medical centers, dental services.

description:
According to the Chief Sanitary Doctor of Karaganda region in Kazakhstan, starting from April 27,  the resumption of work of second-tier banks with legal entities and individuals, branches of Kazpost JSC, as well as lawyers and notary offices is allowed provided the following conditions are met in compliance with sanitary and epidemiological requirements:
1. Before opening cash offices, carry out a high-quality general cleaning of all premises (cash desks, operating rooms, exchange offices, utility rooms, etc.), as well as equipment using detergents and disinfectants (washing all surfaces (tables, chairs, printers, scanners, etc.), including glazed surfaces of natural light frames (windows).
2. Schedule of work from 9.00 to 18.00.
3. Transfer to a remote mode of work of personnel not involved in the work process as much as possible.
4. Treat the area adjacent to the object with disinfectants at least 1 time per day and keep it clean.
5. Provide centralized delivery to and from work on a company bus/vehicle, while providing the driver with hand antiseptic and protective equipment (overalls, masks, and gloves, eye protection/face mask, etc.) with their obligatory change with the required frequency, as well as disinfection of the vehicle interior, can be carried out by wiping or irrigation.

description: Kazakhstan: "Quarantine measures eased in Northern Kazakhstan region on Apr. 28, 2020. Thus, the region will allow operation of small and medium-sized industrial enterprises involved in construction and repair, manufacturing windows and doors, reinforced concrete products, inert materials, and carpentry shops. Road and freight companies, asphalt concrete factories, small construction organizations will resume operation as well. Public Service Centers will be opened to provide services to business. Planned hospitalization and consultative diagnostic assistance are resuming its operation. Law firms, car repair shops, car washes, tire fitting services, dry-cleaning and office equipment repair shops will be opened."

description:
By the President's order of March 15, during the state of emergency, March 16 to April 15, the work of entertainment centres, cinemas, theatres, exhibitions, and other premises of large crowd concentration are closed down in Kazakhstan. 
On April 14, the policy was extended to May 1. 
On April 29, the policy was extended to May 11. UPDATE: The original restriction of businesses was set to last until April 15, it was extended to May 1. Now it is extended to May 11.

description:
According to the Chief Sanitary Doctor of Karaganda region in Kazakhstan, starting from May 3, The resumption of operation of subjects in the field of rendering photography services, flower shops, and pavilions, objects, selling periodicals (newspapers, magazines) is allowed only if the following conditions are met in compliance with sanitary and epidemiological requirements:
- before the opening of objects, carry out a high-quality general cleaning of all rooms, as well as equipment using detergents and disinfectants (washing all surfaces (tables, chairs, shelves, etc.), including glazed surfaces of natural light frames (windows);
- organize service activities for no more than 1 client, in order to exclude crowds of people:
- treat the area adjacent to the object with disinfectants at least 1 time per day and keep it clean.

description:
In Shymkent city, starting from September 28, 2020, until October 26, 2020, quarantine measures are held. 
Food and non-food markets and fairs are allowed to operate from 6.00 to 18.00, subject to a occupancy of no more than 30 percent and an area of ​​​​at least 4 square meters per person.
Covered markets on weekends and holidays are prohibited.
"The activities of the fairs should be carried out in compliance with the enhanced sanitary and disinfection regime, including the installation of a disinfection tunnel and sanitizers," the decree says.
Also, the new document lifts the ban on the operation of children's playgrounds, trampolines and food courts at fairs.

description:
Starting from August 16, 2021 Ashyq applications centers and beauty salons will be able to receive visitors by appointment from 09:00 to 20:00, on weekends - a ban.
Banks, public service centers and post offices - by prior reservation from 09:00 to 18:00 on weekdays.
Also, within the framework of the project, cafes, coffee shops, restaurants, summer venues will be open from 07:00 to 20:00 with a occupancy of no more than 50 places, on Saturday and Sunday - a ban. Food courts on weekdays can operate from 07:00 to 20:00 with a occupancy of no more than 30 places, on weekends - a ban.
Banquet halls will be closed.
Saunas, SPA centers, swimming pools, sports complexes, fitness centers, yoga centers participating in the project will be open from 07:00 to 20:00, their activities will be suspended on weekends.
SEC, shopping malls within the framework of the project will be able to work at 07:00-20:00, markets - until 17:00, on weekends - closed.
And theaters, cinemas, concert halls, philharmonics have set a work schedule from 08:00 to 20:00, on weekends - a ban.

Kazakhstan: "A number of flights to regions will resume in Kazakhstan from May 4. It was decided to resume flights from Nur-Sultan and Almaty to Kyzylorda, Petropavlovsk, Ust-Kamenogorsk and Semey. Flights will be carried out with increased norms of sanitary requirements, smaller number of passengers and special remote seating in the cabin. 
Passangers are allowed to enter an airport only with a certificate of a negative PCR test for COVID-19 (valid for 7 days from the date of issue of the certificate) UPDATE: Passengers are allowed to enter an airport only if they have a certificate with a negative PCR test result for COVID-19 (valid for 7 days from issuance).

description:
"Sessions of the government and the Senate will be held online" from March 16 2020 to April 15, 2020. Similarly, "access of visitors and participants in sessions, as well as representatives of the mass media to the building of the Senate, will be restricted." UPDATE: Kazakhstan, starting May 12, 2020: "Nur-Sultan city's kindergartens will admit only children with certificates from a pediatrician of that the child and everyone in the family are healthy. 
 The opening is allowed for one age group on duty, based on the condition that the distance is not less than one meter in the sleeping areas, but not more than 15 children in the group. These are groups combining nursery and first junior, second junior and combined senior and preschool groups"

UPDATE: The order of the Chief Sanitary Doctor of the Almaty Region № 10 dated on 11th May 2020 requires Akims of districts and cities, rural districts, the Police Department and other involved services of the Almaty region to ensure permission to visit parks, squares and embankments without entertainment facilities for groups of no more than 3 people or members of the same family, observing social distance.

description:
Kazakstan, Aktobe region, starting June 12, 2020: "The chief sanitary doctor decreed to suspend and restrict operations of some businesses as the region reports surge in coronavirus cases:
 - Computer and internet clubs, food courts, children's attractions, recreation camps, nightclubs, karaoke centers, hookah lounges will be temporarily closed down. 
 - It is forbidden to hold mass, solemn, commemorative and memorial events, exhibitions, forums, conferences and other organized public events.
 - Public transport will run from 06:00 a.m. until 09:00 p.m. Masks are mandatory for passengers."

description: On February 4, 2022, the Chief Sanitary Doctor of Kostanay Region, Kazakhstan, permitted religious objects' activities (mosques, churches, cathedrals, synagogues, etc.) individually, at the rate of at least 4 sq. m. per person, without holding collective services and mass events, including having "zhuma", "tarauih", "ayt" prayers, and "auyz ashar", as well as solemn services and events during the celebration of Easter, with a ban on work catering facilities located in them, subject to the requirements of the DCGSD RK No. 67. Conducting collective religious events (including "zhuma namaz", daily Orthodox prayers and others) in the open air on the territory of mosques, Orthodox churches and other religious sites is carried out subject to the mask regime and social distance at the rate of at least 4 meters per person.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
According to the Chief Sanitary Doctor of Karaganda region in Kazakhstan, starting from April 27,  the resumption of work of second-tier banks with legal entities and individuals, branches of Kazpost JSC, as well as lawyers and notary offices is allowed provided the following conditions are met in compliance with sanitary and epidemiological requirements:
1. Before opening cash offices, carry out a high-quality general cleaning of all premises (cash desks, operating rooms, exchange offices, utility rooms, etc.), as well as equipment using detergents and disinfectants (washing all surfaces (tables, chairs, printers, scanners, etc.), including glazed surfaces of natural light frames (windows).
2. Schedule of work from 9.00 to 18.00.
3. Transfer to a remote mode of work of personnel not involved in the work process as much as possible.
4. Treat the area adjacent to the object with disinfectants at least 1 time per day and keep it clean.
5. Provide centralized delivery to and from work on a company bus/vehicle, while providing the driver with hand antiseptic and protective equipment (overalls, masks, and gloves, eye protection/face mask, etc.) with their obligatory change with the required frequency, as well as disinfection of the vehicle interior, can be carried out by wiping or irrigation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
According to the Chief Sanitary Doctor of Karaganda region in Kazakhstan, starting from May 3, The resumption of operation of subjects in the field of rendering photography services, flower shops, and pavilions, objects, selling periodicals (newspapers, magazines) is allowed only if the following conditions are met in compliance with sanitary and epidemiological requirements:
- before the opening of objects, carry out a high-quality general cleaning of all rooms, as well as equipment using detergents and disinfectants (washing all surfaces (tables, chairs, shelves, etc.), including glazed surfaces of natural light frames (windows);
- organize service activities for no more than 1 client, in order to exclude crowds of people:
- treat the area adjacent to the object with disinfectants at least 1 time per day and keep it clean.

description:
Kazakhstan: " The new decree of the deputy chief sanitary doctor of Kostanay region on prolongation of quarantine regulations in order to fight coronavirus infection came into force at 00:00 July 1, 2020.
People are allowed outside to visit parks, squares and to gather in groups of no more than three people or members of one family strictly observing social distancing up to 2 meters. Wearing of masks is recommended outside. It is mandatory to wear face masks at shops, drug stores, health facilities, transport, at work, and other places of public gathering. Movement within the region is allowed.
People under quarantine should install "SmartQOSTANAI" mobile app.
It is forbidden to hold various family, sports and mass events."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

In Kazakhstan, from March 1, 2021, a study in a combined format is allowed for students of preschool grades, from grades 1 to 5 inclusive, in international schools - from grades 1 to 7 inclusive, with the number of children in classes no more than 25 people.

description: By the order of the Chief sanitary doctor of the Akmola Region (Kazakhstan), starting from Jule 15, 2021, people in groups of no more than 3 people or one family are allowed to walk in the parks, and squares. They have to keep a social distance and wear masks and have hand sanitizers.
